document.text:
From: Jack Scarola  
To: 
Cc: 
, "Chris R. Rodgers" 
Subject: Re:  
Date: Thu, 28 Jan 2021 18:19:14 +0000 
(USANYS)" 
Thank you, . This is very good news. You can count on us to provide whatever support may be 
reasonably necessary. 
On Jan 28, 2021, at 1:16 PM, wrote: 
Jack, 
I was just able to confer with our office's Victim-Witness Coordinator. She informed me that our office will be able to pay 
fora, husband, and three minor children to travel with her to New York for her testimony and 
then back to Florida. She also confirmed that our office will be able to pay for a hotel suite that is large enough to 
accommodate—, her husband, and her children. 
We will reach out to coordinate the logistics closer to the trial date. For now, the trial is scheduled to begin on July 12, 
2021. I'll plan to reach back out in March or April to provide you with an update on timing and to potentially schedule a 
time for me to meet with for trial prep. 
As always, please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions or concerns. 
Best, 
From: 
Sent: Thursday, January 28, 2021 1:06 PM 
To: Jack Scarola 
Cc: I ; (USANYS) 
Subject: RE: 
Jack, 
Thank you very much for letting us know. That's great to hear, and I completely understand desire to have her 
family with her as support when she testifies. I will work with our Victim-Witness Coordinator and with the FBI's Victim 
Services folks to figure out what we can do about funding fox family to join her in New York. I'll get back to you 
as soon as I have information about those logistics. 
Best, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
New York, NY 10007 
From: Jack Scarola 
Sent: Wednesday, January 27, 2021 3:59 PM 
To: 
) '`c>
Cc: 
I <> 
(USANYS) 
Subject: Re 
EFTA00027350

My apologies for not getting back to you following my meeting with yesterday, but it took until today to get a final 
response from 
She is willing to commit to testify but she definitely wants her husband and children with her when in NY for trial in July. 
While she does not presently have the ability to finance her family's travel at this time, she might be willing and able to 
set aside funds she might receive from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Fund to at least partially defray related 
expenses. 
Please let us know what commitment the government is able to make in this regard. 
I hope your trip home went smoothly. 
On Jan 27, 2021, at 3:10 PM, 
*ca 
wrote: 
Hi Jack, 
Any word from? Apologies for pestering, but there are a number of steps we'll need to take in the near term if we 
are going to expand our case to include- testimony. 
Thanks very much, 
From: 
Sent: Monday, January 25, 2021 4:11 PM 
To: Jack Scarola 
Cc: 
Subject: RE 
Thank you. 
From: Jack Scarola •z:M> 
Sent: Monday, January 25, 2021 4:10 PM 
To: 
Cc: (USANYS) 
Subject: Re :
-
I am scheduled to conference withatomorrow afternoon and should have an answer for you then. 
(USANYS) 
Sent from my iPad 
On Jan 25, 2021, at 3:32 PM, 
‹) 
wrote: 
Jack, 
It was a  pleasure to see you in person last week. Thank you for being so accommodating and kind during my trip down 
to Florida. 
I'm just checking in to see whether-has made a decision about whether she would be willing to testify at our 
trial. And, of course, I am happy to have a call to discuss or answer any questions if that would be useful. 
Best, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
New York, NY 11. 
112-637-2324 
******************************************************************************************
